intro: Draba verna subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the early whitlow grass, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically reaches heights of 5–20 cm and features basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white or pale yellow during early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. This subspecies is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and is well adapted to cold, harsh climates.
